revised_title: Microbial Energetics: Routes for Energy Conservation and Efficiency Assessment
tldr: This article discusses the various routes by which bacteria derive energy, focusing on substrate level phosphorylation and oxidative phosphorylation. It also explores the chemiosmotic hypothesis, which explains how electron transport-dependent reactions drive ATP synthesis. The article highlights the importance of understanding microbial energetics for predicting growth yields and manipulating energy conversion efficiency in bacteria.
